website_summaries.verdict: An overall excellent camera, but one that fails to capture the best-in-class prize for image quality.
pros: The Canon EOS 70D's new sensor delivers excellent autofocus performance and the camera itself is quite fast
Its design is reasonably streamlined and the feature set appropriately tailored to the target market as well
cons: The image quality doesn't overly impress for this price class, and certain aspects of the design -- notably single card slot, hard-to-control multicontroller and the Wi-Fi/movie mode conflict resolution -- are annoying

customer_reviews.title: Heartbroken *updated*  fixed!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Canon will now repair the faulty board free of charge. I just got mine back from Canon service and it's working like it used to. I have since given the 70D deserved 5 stars. I've had this camera just 4 years and absolutely loved it. I would've given it 5 stars a month ago, but since then, I got the dreaded error 80. $500 to fix a defect Canon is well aware of. Why has this not been recalled? Do a little research on error 80 or focus issues on the 70d and you will find both are common. So disappointed and just...heartbroken. I have a small fortune invested in Canon glass and no camera!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Takes amazing photos.
customer_reviews.text: Where to start. This camera body takes FANTASTIC pictures. You can shoot like a pro in no time. Low light, bright light. Doesn't matter. The wifi is a little quirky but does allow you to transfer pictures to an iPad, iPhone or other pretty easily if you don't have an SD slot. Make sure you get a FAST SDXC card (90MB/sec) otherwise you will have caching problems when taking video. Get a large (>32GB) card as well. And get a second battery or battery grip or you'll be out of battery in no time. And of course, there's nothing like pairing this with great lenses from canon. If you go cheap in those you diminish this camera's capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: DinerX

customer_reviews.title: Canon 70d is a great camera
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera. Error 80 kept coming up. The camera is great but the one I got used (like new) overheated quickly. I dont know if its normally like that. I have one i purchased a few years ago. Still works great but this new one is giving my overheating problems. Sent it to canon and they repaired for free. Great camera normally but the one that was sold to me wasnt very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: A serious upgrade from my Rebel
customer_reviews.text: I had a Rebel T2i which I loved but... was frustrated at it's limits. This camera relieved those frustrations. The pictures are crisp and sharp. Actions shots are clearer. the modes are a lot more versatile and easier to use. The auto focus system is far superior, quicker and more accurate. If you are ready to take your photography to the next level I would Highly recommend this camera. It is leaps and bounds better than the Rebel line (which are really nice cameras, but limited).
customer_reviews.author: MIkey J

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this beauty
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this beauty! I use this one for making videos on my YouTube channel along with a wide angle lens and a Rode shotgun mic and the quality of my videos has instantly gotten better, courtesy its awesome auto focus feature. I had used a Panasonic HC-770 camcorder for about 3 years before taking the DLSR route and I'm kicking myself for not having done it earlier. If you are a video content creator, then this is probably on the better values of money in terms of the ROI. There are a few other decent cameras from Sony, Nikon and Panasonic that are available for a cheaper price, but I'd take the 70D over those any day.
customer_reviews.author: Stalkerboy_88

customer_reviews.title: ... just by the few times of usage I absolutely LOVE this camera and all the functions it contains
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert by any means when it comes to cameras - especially such expensive and professional ones as these - however just by the few times of usage I absolutely LOVE this camera and all the functions it contains. We purchased this for my husband since he desperately needed it to work on his film projects but I am also able to use for my own personal projects. The clarity is absolutely amazing and the wide range of lens is completely worth the price. We also love that the microphone comes with it - I am still learning about it but so far its been great.
customer_reviews.author: Fatima84

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from Rocky Mountain Brown and it's great. I can't see any damage and the image quality is great. The camera itself is great. I upgraded to this from the T6. It has everything I wanted, higher ISO, more focus points, mic port, and a top screen. I just got the camera so I can't say much yet, but I've attached some photos I've taken outside my house. I used the 50mm 1.8.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Promer Camera
customer_reviews.text: I doubt I need to say much about this camera as all the high end Cannon or Nikon cameras tend to be great purchases. This one is no different. I am still learning just how versatile this beast is but I have no complaints. The best thing is that it takes amazing photos just on the stock settings. You don't have much of a learning curve to really up your game by buying this camera and letting it do all the work. It's great. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Blithe

customer_reviews.title: ... EOS Rebel with the 70D and the results are amazing. Granted
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded my 8 year old EOS Rebel with the 70D and the results are amazing. Granted, technology has greatly improved, but once you learn how to use the features, I've gotten some great results. The most commonly changed functions are easily accessible from the touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for stuck pixels!
customer_reviews.text: I like my 70D a lot! Auto focus is fast, and Live View shooting with the articulating screen helps with landscape composition. I would have given 5 stars, but my first 70D had multiple stuck pixels right out of the box. They were red and showed up in the same place in every image, even at fast shutter speeds and low ISO. A bit of research revealed that this seems to be relatively common with this model. I promptly returned the camera and ordered another 70D. The second one appears to have zero stuck pixels, so life is looking good!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with very good features
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with very good features. I shoot 99% still pics, but the video quality is great and the auto focus in video mode is impressive, things seem to just immediately snap into focus. I do a lot of action photos and the seven frames a second in RAW mode is great for that. Didn't think I would use it much, but the touch screen is a handy feature. Camera has a lot of features that take some time to figure out how to use, but reading the whole instruction book and looking up tutorials online is worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had an XSi and a T5i. This is a big step up in the quality of workmanship. The live view focus is amazingly fast and accurate. Ultimately more accurate than the viewfinder. Makes live view shooting and video shooting a real joy. Dual dials make adjustments quick and easy. Ability to customize HDR, multiple exposures, etc. give great control. 7 fps are great. The only thing I'd like to see is giving the white balance its own button. Very happy to recommend this fine camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mick in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Prolonged lusting and waiting is not good for the soul!  Get it now!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one of these 70Ds since it first hit the internet sites! I owned a 50D at the time, and loved it, but you know how love is! Here today, sell it tomorrow. I sold the 50D and scraped up the rest of the bread and ordered this baby! I totally love it! I fall in love too easy most times, or so I'm told, but my love affair with this camera will last a long, long time. I won't bore you with the features, as you are already aware of most of them, or you wouldn't be looking at this camera. It's terrific! And the bundled deal I got through Amazon made it even better!
customer_reviews.author: ActiveShooter

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Just do it.
customer_reviews.text: The box to the actual product was damage, not a big deal. Inspected the camera and other items in the box to make sure that nothing was damaged everything was good to go. Highly recommend this camera for a run and gun rig, personally using an 18-135mm lens along with a cage for my Rode shotgun mic and handle. I use this camera for mostly filming rather than photography still takes great photos regardless of the glass you are using. This is the perfect camera for a one man army.
customer_reviews.author: Shaff

customer_reviews.title: Good service, good camera, good price!
customer_reviews.text: The item came very well packed. The box that it came in was not the original kit box - it said that it had a different lens, and the serial number did not match. The ad mentioned that it may have some scuffs and scratches, and it did - on the front element of the lens! Thus far, I can't see that it has much influence on the quality of the images. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase, though - the price was excellent, and the camera is functional in every way. My first purchase after I received it was a UV filter to protect the lens... ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Programmed obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: With only 3 years old the CMOS and the Image circuit burn after error 80 only use with canon original lens and battery. And Sandisk extreme memory card, few short movies and about 6.000 shots. To me it is a programmed obsolescence. They already know the problem but they don't create a recall program. If you want to fix you will spend more than 300 box.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro I. B. Bruder

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about ordering this camera, given that it's about $200 less than Amazon is selling the same camera for. It came in brand new in the box, with all of the accessories (strap, cords, instructions, etc). It is exactly the same as the one being sold for 1100 on here, so if all you need is the body and you're trying to decide between the two, go with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: If You've Mastered Others...
customer_reviews.text: It's more than a beginner's camera. If you have mastered other cameras, you can probably pick this up with no problem. I haven't shot a lot of video with it but I've taken plenty of photographs. It's has a fast burst speed to it compared to my Panasonic GH1k. I wanted a camera that is heavier in weight and this is it. Ergonomic. I find that there are quite a few EF lenses to choose from. I have 3 now with 2 on the way. Photos are large. Follow focusing functions for video are really good. Nice range of ISO settings for lower light. Touchscreen on the lcd is a nice added feature.
customer_reviews.author: Tieuel Legacy

customer_reviews.title: Canon 70D is smart and professional
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. A good balance of the latest technology and affordability. If you're not interested in the HD video with sophisticated lenses, the 60D is probably all you need but this 70D is a camera that simply wasn't possible at a reasonable price a few years ago. Canon excels at smarter, more advanced technology (while Nikon does slightly better at making cameras that feel like film cameras used to) and this camera does not disappoint. Unless you need full frame (and you almost certainly don't), this is the top of the line.
customer_reviews.author: TheProfessor

customer_reviews.title: Great Prosumer DSLR! Good upgrade from Rebel line!
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short as this camera sells itself! Upgraded from the 650D/T4i. This unit has significantly improved ISO response yielding much less noise between the 1000-2000 range. Great build quality and the buttons are placed perfectly within reach. Wi-Fi may seem gimmicky, but has proven great for clients wanting to get glimpse of themselves during the shoot.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hodaee

customer_reviews.title: The 40D had a magnesium body and just felt nice to use
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 40D, never really saw the 50 or 60 as an upgrade. The 40D had a magnesium body and just felt nice to use. The 70D finally has that feeling again, though the dial on the back could be a bit more "clicky" in my opinion. Great for video. Auto focus is amazing. Really amazing. Rarely even hunts in the dark, though I do tend to use 2.8 or faster lenses. Low light abilities are pretty solid, though full frames will appease pixel peepers better. I'd buy it again, though I won't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good all around camera
customer_reviews.text: Great all around camera. I'm a hobbyist but I do a lot of live shows for free entry and beer. I wish it was better in the dark as the autofocus has some issues in low light but that is what the big boy full frames are for. I also found some adapters and vintage Russian lenses for some very artistic touches.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Smith

customer_reviews.title: An amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I am new to photography and have been told by many that DSLR cameras are "dead". Too big, too bulky, etc. Doesn't matter to me though. I love this camera. I have used it on many things from shooting concerts to portraits. The amount of options and features are amazing. I was amazed by the first photos I took using this camera compared to my crappy point-n-shoot that I had. This camera is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: ZombieGoats

customer_reviews.title: Flawless!
customer_reviews.text: It came 11 days before it was supposed to arrive shipped within hours also. Couldn't ask for a better product! It came in original box with everything that was listed in the description. Everything is brand new in original wrapping and everything. Awesome! Now for the product itself flawless absolutely flawless! All the manuals and CD ROM all the cords to connect everything up! Battery, Battery Charger, Strap, SD card and Card Reader all in original packaging! I'm telling you that I am thoroughly impressed I wasn't really sure and just wow!
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: 70D is a great pro-consumer camera, huge upgrade from 2009 T1i,
customer_reviews.text: This DSLR I got as upgrade from my 2009 Canon T1i, there are so many things I love about it: -Pro-consumer display give more info and easy control over the camera -the flip out back is great for astrophotography, save your neck from twisting -the 18-135 is a great walk-around lens -ISO is usable to 3200 easily, and 6400 with modest noise reduction applied I attach some samples I took myself, from out west vacation and the moon from my front yard
customer_reviews.author: Mike R PE

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY one for the IndieFilmakers! <3
customer_reviews.text: So, I make youtube videos from time to time, also I do a few gigs when needed, and have been a film student for quite some years...but I can honestly say this is hands down, the best camera I've ever had. When doing film, I'm not a huge fan of auto-focus, but its the best, right next to sony 6000, depending on the lens. (Not Noisy) But, for shooting yourself, the kids, and sometimes the occasional film, this camera has a lot to offer to EVERYONE! And it takes awesome photos! :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: ... have never had a DSLR before but I am happy that I chose the 70D
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a DSLR before but I am happy that I chose the 70D. It is an amazing camera. It has a plethora of features including in camera wifi, which I often use. I can use an app on my phone that allows me to remote access my camera so that I can take pictures without actually being there. It is a neat little feature. I have had it a few months now and I am impressed. It is also really easy to use and get used to. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love this cam
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I waited for this model, it is easy to handle, and takes good pictures. It does have many features and many selections for each button which makes it confusing at times. I like the ability to take movies with his camera. The ability of viewing through the lens is a plus, so is the swiveling LCD screen. Setting up wifi hotspot is a bit cumbersome, I wish it was made easier. It does not have capability to transfer pictures to a computer via wifi though. The battery does not seem to hold charge for a long time compared to my Canon Rebel XT.
customer_reviews.author: pacsailor

customer_reviews.title: Of course the 70D accepts the excellent lenses I bought for the Rebel
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge step up from my Canon Rebel T3i. Of course the 70D accepts the excellent lenses I bought for the Rebel. It has a comfortable and secure-feeling grip with nice controls layout. Auto focus is fast and accurate. The swivel viewing screen is extremely sharp, making photos look better than they do on my 7-yr-old iMac monitor. I have used only a fraction of its features so far and I'm looking forward to taking movies.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Metal

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: As a hobby/enthusiast photographer/videographer, my overall EXPERIENCE using this DSLR has been great, and for that alone I give this body a highly recommended rating. Safe to say that I'm very happy with my purchase for this DSLR body (very good-used condition) for ~$820 on amazon, for that price range, a lot of other brands come to mind along with options, but being raised on Canon, I am biased towards the user interface and menus, but if that usability and ease of functionality doesn't matter to you AND you're willing to go through the learning curve of a different camera system, go ahead, but know that my money is with THIS camera system.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo R. Ruano

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: Being my first DSLR I have to say that I love it. It stepped my photography game up and I love it. I can’t complain. It’s a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great midline camera for baby portraits
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is a great compromise between a novice and a pro camera. I do baby portraits and young children will not look at you if your face is behind the camera so I find the movable touch screen to be a must have feature so I can see what the camera is seeing while being a distance away from the camera
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Great Prosumer Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome. It's a great value for your money. One of the best things is it focuses on the fly while you are taking movies, which is generally unprecedented. I could rave about all sorts of cool features it has, but I'll just say I love that the viewing screen is not only fully articulated so it will adjust to the angle you are shooting from, but it is also a touch screen. Far more eloquent people have articulated reviews than I, so I'll leave it at that.
customer_reviews.author: DeeAndTee

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR at an Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for us, to replace our aging Digital Rebel. WOW, what a difference. Great pictures, easy to use and carry, everything we expected from another Canon. We did not get a chance to compare this side by side with the more expensive professional models before buying it, so really can't speak to how it stacks up. But compared to our old DSLR, it is an order of magnitude nicer in picture quality and functionality. Shooting our son's wedding with rapid fire allowed us to capture just the right moment time and time again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best Canon body I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best Canon body I have ever owned. over the last 45 years, including pro models, etc. Sold my 7D and 60D when I got this.. Incredible high ISO performance. Nice feature set and I do not do video! Can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Gene A. Staver

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera with a decent budget
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner camera. I started my YouTube channel this year and love the video and picture quality of my shots. All my family and friends think I'm some super professional, but I love capturing big and important moments in high quality. If you aren't that into photography or videography yet and want to start with a decent budget, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best price for 70D body on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This listing looked too good to be true for the price. But Im happy to say we recieved a brand new camera body. You can clearly see it was a body + lens combo box originally, but the lens had been removed. Since the listing is for body only, this is perfect. The price was outstanding and I got a brand new 70D. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera body!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a 40D for years and really liked it. Love the higher megapixels of this camera because I shoot a lot with a zoom lens, hence quite a bit of cropping. Same great burst-rate as the 40D but lots of other more advanced options. I haven't used the video much and may not as I mostly shoot stills so no opinion on that good or bad. The articulating view screen is great! I haven't fiddled around with the touch-screen options yet but that seems like it will be a plus once I take the time to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave U.

customer_reviews.title: Feature filled and yet still easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Feature filled and yet still easy to use. The touch screen makes on-th-fly changes easy. The variety of focusing and exposure options provides great flexibility in controlling the image. The included lens is very good, but not great. The only problem that I have had is an occasional flash malfunction, getting an error code 5. This is apparently a fairly common error. My solution has been to simply turn off the flash when I do not need it. It has not affected the overall function of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: WestcliffeCO

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! The flip and turn screen is so great. I use that more than the eye viewer. And its crystal clear and sharp. Connecting the camera to the wifi is very challening, however once its done its easy there forward. My pictures look great and i hope to be able to get more lenses to try out.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I’m no professionally, but I really love how well this camera body works! It does everything so seamlessly and such good quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Piueti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for every event
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is awesome. Video is excellent. Use camera for program events at work and family holidays. Now I can keep every memory in clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Benraymond

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded to the 70D and it is by far the best yet. AF at night (very low light) is ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're serious about buying this camera, you've probably already done tons of research. If you are on the fence, I will say this: I had a 10D, 1D, 40D, and 60D. I upgraded to the 70D and it is by far the best yet. AF at night (very low light) is tremendous. WiFi works great once set up.
customer_reviews.author: ZT Ross

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Just got my camera in the mail 3 hours ago and I already have to send it back. I got the camera mainly for videos and when u press the start /record button the screen freezes. It won’t even turn off with the off switch, you have to pull the battery out just to get it started again. After looking up solutions on the internet I learned that something is wrong with pcb board and the camera will eventually stop working all together. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for video and photos
customer_reviews.text: A really good camera. Moved from the T3i to this camera and it is a great improvement. The auto focus is great when you are solo and shooting video. The wifi mode is great when you are out and about and capture a great shot and you want to post it online right away. I mostly use this camera for video and the footage looks great. Im happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chaos

customer_reviews.title: this is the best option in its price range
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my t2i to this. For videographers, this is the best option in its price range. The autofocus capabilities are far better than its competition; all in all it provides superior pictures. Very intuitive, very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for video
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for video. I debated whether to wait until the end of March and cough up several hundred dollars more for the new 80D, but I decided to go with this, because of all the rave reviews. Sure the new features will be nice, but I'll be lucky to use all the features on this camera. There is a learning curve to figure out what all the settings do, but there are plenty of online videos to walk you through anything you want to know.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Went for this camera because it had the most features ...
customer_reviews.text: Went for this camera because it had the most features relevant to my intended use which was shooting videos for YouTube in well lit rooms that have been made for radio. If you want to do low light video I highly suggest investing in a lens that has an aperture around 1.2/1.4 as this just aint gonna cut it unless you boost up to around 1600/1400 ISO. Do not expect to use the Rode Mic bundled with it if you've plans to use the AC Adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: 70D kit has it all!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS CAMERA!!! If you are looking to shoot video with a DSLR but don't have a HUGE budget, this is definitely the camera for you! The kit comes with everything to start shooting right out of the box! I have used it for months now and dont have a single complaint! Take care of it and it will take care of you! Highly recommend and honestly just wish I had another one!
customer_reviews.author: DizzyFoto Product Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Enthusiast Level Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera about a week ago, love it a lot since I'm coming from an entry level DSLR. I know the Canon 80D already came out but i still decided to get this because its a little cheaper with the 18-135mm lens and its not much of an upgrade to the 80D. Other than that i think i will stick to this camera until i decide to upgrade to a full frame. Great Camera. The Pictures i provided were post processed through Lightroom cc 2015.
customer_reviews.author: BoxerE1195

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS 70D
customer_reviews.text: After one month of use, I have found the camera to be everything that has been advertised about it. Easy to use and wonderful picture quality.The touch screen window and menu selection is an absolute joy. A light year leap over my old 60D. Being a crop body camera, it may have its limitations for a pro, but very few for a hobbyist. I considered moving up either 6D or 7D, but then I would have to give up my walk around lens (15-85 mm) and decided to purchase this camera. Zero regrets.
customer_reviews.author: oldguy

customer_reviews.title: Seemed too good to be true...
customer_reviews.text: I was cautious in purchasing from this seller as the price seemed too good to be true.... I was worried it wouldn't be an English version or that it would be used. I decided to go ahead and try. It arrived very quickly. In the canon box. I've taken it shooting, it worked as expected! Touch screen, and quality seems great! Only problem I had was the included memory card didn't work, I contacted the seller and they promptly sent me a new one without any hassle. I am happy to report I have been very pleasantly surprised. I will update this if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: Niknak

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. I purchased this as an upgrade to my T3i which I was able to sell in less than a week. Love the pictures and options. The wifi is very nice too so you don't have to carry around a remote, just use your phone. Great work Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, I love that it can record movies ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, I love that it can record movies as the last dslr camera I had did not have that option (canon rebel xsi). This also has the wifi and upload photos straight to your phone option and app which is really convenient for when you want to upload a photo right away!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: My previous Canon 70D shutter broke after 5 years of use. When investigating a new camera to purchase, I decided to repurchase the 70D. It was a great price point because it is the older model but works fantastic for my needs. Although I am just a hobbyist, I am excited to fix my other 70D and will have 2 identical bodies to shoot with different lens.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Thompson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: works great, always reliable, droped it in a lake twice and it still works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i love the 70d
customer_reviews.text: it's touch screen and you cant get better camera without going for 1dx. but what the 80d?? I think the only upgrade they made on the 80d was on video . i shoot stills . that was i heard check it out. so if you shoot stills great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The perfect body!
customer_reviews.text: The short: Amazing! This body gives you everything you need to capture super high quality images. The live screen is awesome, it will display any lens tweaks and show you your final product in real time! And the wifi control is slick once you get it paired to your device (note-you need to turn off the sleep functions on your devices and the camera). Be sure that you aren't a cheapskate and skimp on your glass, that is the key to this cameras power. This is the perfect platform for the aspiring photographer. Kudos Canon!
customer_reviews.author: The Fix

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. So awesome. Great video, great pictures. I am a professional studio photographer, but I use the studio equipment. I've used the 20D, 40D, 60D, 1D, and a few others. For my personal camera, I replaced my Rebel t2i with the 70D. I am very happy with this upgrade and compared to the studio cameras it is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Love it. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love it. Love it. From the flip out screen in the back to the wifi control to take family pictures with my 89-year-old father. This has been a workhorse. In the last year I have shot over 15,000 pictures and the 70D has kept up with me. Over a dozen senior picture last fall sometimes shooting 4 days a week and never a problem. I'm a part time photographer and couldn't be happier with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Climer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost a year now, and I love the camera! I used 60D before (didn't own though) and now I cannot compare the new 70d. It's so much faster. It takes a bling of an eye to get the focus and to shoot. The quality is awesome, well, as much as the lens allows. But even with this 18-135 kit lens I get decent photos. Speed and Colors are awesome, for the rest I do not care really much, I am not a professional.
customer_reviews.author: AYM

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this for sister , it's picture quality is insane came out perfectly. love it
customer_reviews.author: khai b.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for price
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic design is a major plus as all the buttons are easy to reach. Everything feels nice and premium. The picture quality always comes out exceptional considering it isn’t a really expensive camera when compared to the others. The autofocus that canon has with this camera is the best I have seen considering that it came out in 2013. Overall very good camera for videography and photography.
customer_reviews.author: Kyrios

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for video. excellent high speed burst mode, no missing action shots
customer_reviews.text: I really love this camera. I had been renting it from Borrow Lenses but was approved for financing with the amazon store card so i decided to purchase it instead of racking up more rental fees. I'm so glad i bought it. Feels good in my hands, excellent photo qualify, silent autofocus and high speed burst mode. With enough light and Sandisc extreme plus, i can hold down the button with burst mode set to high and the buffer never seems to run out, it keeps going and going. I also like the metal mount vs the plastic one on my old T1i
customer_reviews.author: Knowledge is Power

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to my Granddaughter. She took it to Australia to take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Canon 70D!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Canon 70D DSLR I picked up. Was looking for a step up and was deciding between a 70D and 7D and I really believe I made the right choice. I love the wifi whereas I wasn't sure how I would feel about it and the touchscreen/flip out screen is a great bonus that the 7D does not have. AF tracking is a hug bonus also. Have taken many extremely high quality pictures and video so far and more to come!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Dykstra

customer_reviews.title: It is great and I love it and it works fine
customer_reviews.text: Update: Two pixels are not dead. I just did not have enough knowledge. It was something to do with long exposures and noise reduction. It is just perfect and I recently paired this body with Canon 70 - 200 f4 L IS and was able to see the sharpest images with crazy nice bokeh and with beautiful colors. It is just great and if you are thinking about buying this - don`t think - just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: a second back up body to go with another 70d ...
customer_reviews.text: a second back up body to go with another 70d for when i dont have time to change a lens from ultra wide angle to telephoto. there are other, more detailed reviews worth reading, but for my hobby/enthusiast requirements, the 70d fit the bill. the only thing canon left off of this body, that i really wish had been included, is built in gps. otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: DCC

customer_reviews.title: Bought used and works perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first but it came like BRAND NEW!! it wasn’t in the original box, but came with everything except any lens because I only bought the body. Everything in the picture shows what it came with.
customer_reviews.author: kenia

customer_reviews.title: The audio is a deal-breaker
customer_reviews.text: This camera is toted by reviewers online as being one of the best in terms of video quality. Well that's true, but the audio is filled with the infamous audio background hiss. The shotgun mic it comes with doesn't have a setting to limit sound input to +20 or +40 dB. So basically the mic is not much better than the built-in camera mic. The picture quality is very high-quality as is the video quality. The audio is a deal-breaker though. You NEED an external mic with adjustable dB.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a like new camera!
customer_reviews.text: A like new camera! Great price and perfect camera. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben DeJong

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera! Even though it is half frame
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera! Even though it is half frame, enough for your family life and tour time. High speed continuous shooting is very good, and WiFi is easy and convenient. Movie mode is professional, you can get a good video,smooth and clear.
customer_reviews.author: weibo zhang

customer_reviews.title: Sold a broken camera. My 17 yo daughter has learned a lesson on dishonest salespeople.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is broken. The auto focus doesn’t work. Seller will not refund and Canon will repair the camera for $370+. Casey should be ashamed of himself.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera for the price. This is a good camera for anyone in the intermediate level or really anyone starting out. I love the touch screen as it just makes everything easier. It is rugged and will definitely get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Canon T1i and this is superior in nearly every way
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Canon T1i and this is superior in nearly every way. Particularly useful is low light performance and fast focusing speed, not to mention speed for rapid photo sequences. The touchscreen grows on you. Expensive, but worth it if you are upgrading from earlier canon bodies and already have APS-c lenses so don't want to go to full frame.
customer_reviews.author: Older Expert

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best camera for beginners who want to take up photography or videography! Excellent camera for YouTube and can do a lot of unique features alone! Down side is there is not a feature for time lapse! But they do have a remote for that!
customer_reviews.author: James Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Had watched reviews and personal friends with this camera before making my choice and so far love it and hav ent been disappointed. Love the touch screen features, Wi-Fi capabilities. I always hhesitate buyong brand newitems due to the unknown, therecore even with a new model out chose the 70D ovwr the new 80D.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Manson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit, it has everything needed to start a Photograph and Video Production Career
customer_reviews.author: Karim Molino

customer_reviews.title: Great for video
customer_reviews.text: I run a small media company and this is our go to camera for most video shoots. The images are crisp and rich...especially at this price point. Pulling focus is not difficult at all and the auto focus does a nice job for motion shots. The few times I have used it for stills I was happy...but still prefer my Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Georges

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It's absolutely amazing. Heavy, so if you're going for a vlogging camera, maybe try something lighter, otherwise, perfect for video.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery. Great packaging. Nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great color. Very responsive. I like that it has somewhat of a weather-proof body.
customer_reviews.author: Jon the Great

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything that is claims and more! The performance as a DSLR is right on target for a cameras of this caliber. The ability to record video is a great bonus. If you are an avid hobbyist or semi-pro shooter, you will not be disappointed. This is a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: RE-View

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my son graduating cinema studies at NYU - he was thrilled with this camera. Great pics and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: MARY SALCH

customer_reviews.title: Great combination with my lens and ND filter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera along with a sigma 18-35 and ND filter. Great combination for shooting video and the ND filter allows shooting in broad daylight. Also love the combination of the fast auto focus of the 70d with the low aperture bokeh from the sigma. If you'd like to see here are some test footage of my canon 70d with the lens and ND filter: youtube[dot]com/watch?v=EsayGhcBnyw
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to use in auto mode
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fully automatic, or you can program it any way you want to take pictures. It is very easy to use in auto mode, and works well in all the other settings if you program it correctly. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got for my wife.. and she loves it.. and all her old canon attachments work with it etc..
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera with all of my heart!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! It really is
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! It really is. It surprised me to find that it had a touchscreen, which I didn't realize upon purchasing it, but it has really been helpful. It also has a few editing features such as a fisheye effect which is cool. The pictures come out really clear and much better than my last model (which was a Rebel T3). It even came a week earlier than expected!
customer_reviews.author: jakeh42

customer_reviews.title: I am a Canon Customer For Life
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon EOS 70 D body. This time I bought the 18-135 mm zoom lens. My first EOS 70 D body contains the Canon 28-70mm zoom. Together, these cover the waterfront.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bob

customer_reviews.title: I love this EOS 70D
customer_reviews.text: I love this EOS 70D, it's my first time to use such professional camera, simple to use, photos are beautiful. and I love the wireless function, it is pretty easy to copy my favor pic to cell phone and also using my cell phone to control the camera: edit and delete or remote control...etc function. prefect camera, my 4 year old boy also hold it and take photo for me, he love it too. We are enjoy all pic which from EOS 70D we took!!
customer_reviews.author: Dalina

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I downgraded to this from the 5D ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I downgraded to this from the 5D mkiii, because of the auto-focus video and flippable screen and have definitely benefitted from it. I miss the full frame sensor of the nicer cameras but for the way I'm using it the trade off for those features was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, exactly what they promised and more
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my order. My camera feels brand new and they even included an extra battery and memory card. The product is exactly what they promised in their description. Thank you much for being honest.

customer_reviews.title: Batter life sucks
customer_reviews.text: The battery dies quick I emailed the seller about it no response I'm so mad that they did not reply to my message
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Knight

customer_reviews.title: I love the crispness of the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I love the crispness of the pictures. I bought this because we have young children and I realized that the pictures and videos that I have been taking on my cell phone leave a lot to be desired. This Canon fits the bag to fix that. I also have a Canon printer and can print the photos using wireless without any hassle at all. I can set the paper size on the camera and tell it to print. It's great. Just what I was looking for.

customer_reviews.title: Have not received a refund on the item to my bank. Lawyer will be called
customer_reviews.text: Camera Has not been refunded to my bank. I will be calling my lawyer. I need to buy another camera that works and can't do it because I haven't received money to my bank yet.

customer_reviews.title: Camera body still made in Japan!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised to receive a retail boxed camera and lens (from Focus Camera) with U.S.A. warrantee. Upgraded from a 40D and really love the compact size and light weight of both the camera and lens. The 18-135 lens is perfect for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Clevor

customer_reviews.title: My first ever Canon SLR camera and I am not disappointed with it whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line quality camera. My first ever Canon SLR camera and I am not disappointed with it whatsoever! Great for vlogs and picture taking-- although I prefer it for vlogging mainly because of the adjustable screen.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera. Feels good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Feels good and sturdy, very responsive. The 18-135 STM lens delivers great quality. Pair it with a 50mm f1.8 or 1.4 if your budget allows for very sharp images. Read around when you buy it about the 70d center focus point issue and make sure you test yours as soon as you get it.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera. It's everything I hoped for. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because there is dirt and smudges on the mirror inside the camera and I can see it through the viewfinder. It doesn't seem to effect the images but it's annoying when I'm taking them. Otherwise I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a hobby photographer!  very pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, coming from a canon xsi. It focuses really fast, great in lower light, and takes amazing videos. All the features are great. Terrific colors are captured in the pictures. Definitely a great upgrade. Has multiple raw file sizes available for editing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Canon EOS 70D Digital SLR Camera with 18-135mm STM Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:w/ 18-135mm| Configuration:BaseThe Canon 8469B016 EOS 70D 20.2MP Digital SLR Camera Body plus EF-S 18-135mm IS STM Standard Zoom Lens features an APS-C CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5+ image processor to ensure high-resolution images and excellent low-light sensitivity. Both the sensor and processor work together to produce well-detailed, clear imagery that exhibits natural tonality and color gradations with minimal noise when working in difficult lighting conditions. The processor also provides notable speed throughout the camera system, including the ability to record up to 7 fps in full-resolution, quickened AF speeds, and full HD 1080p video recording. The 3.0-inch Clear View II touchscreen LCD monitor profits greatly from the advent Dual Pixel CMOS AF system and its ability to utilize Touch AF focusing for finely controlled selection of the point of focus. The monitor's vari-angle design also enables more efficient shooting and viewing from both high and low angles and an anti-reflective, smudge-resistant coating allows for clear well-detailed viewing. The included 18-135mm IS STM standard zoom lens features a refined Image Stabilization system that delivers up to four equivalent stops of shake correction throughout the zoom range and offers a maximum magnification of 0.28x at the telephoto end.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

MEET THE NEW GAME-CHANGER
Changing the way users capture still images and video with a DSLR camera, Canon proudly introduces the EOS 70D – a trailblazing powerhouse featuring a revolutionary autofocus technology that unlocks the potential of Live View: Dual Pixel CMOS AF. This game-changing technology allows the EOS 70D to capture video in Live View with smooth and precise autofocus similar to that of a camcorder, complete with the superb image quality that is a hallmark of EOS cameras. Additionally, Dual Pixel CMOS AF provides fast and accurate autofocus during Live View still image capture, enabling you to fully benefit from the freedom of angle allowed by the Vari-angle Touch Screen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II. Compositional options are now nearly limitless with the two real-world choices of Live View and viewfinder shooting. To further empower the photographer, Canon engineers spent months ensuring that the cutting-edge Dual Pixel CMOS AF on the EOS 70D is compatible with 103◊ Canon EF lenses, greatly expanding creative possibilities. Built-in wireless technology and the EOS Remote app* further enhance shooting versatility, as well as enable easy sharing. Brilliant image quality is provided by the EOS 70D’s 20.2 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor, a first for an EOS camera with an APS-C sized sensor. A powerful DIGIC 5+ Image Processor supports continuous shooting up to 7.0 frames per second, as well as an extended ISO range of 100–12800 (H: 25600) that allows shooting in a wide variety of lighting conditions. Stunning photos can be accomplished using the remarkable 19-point all cross-type AF system with a high precision dual cross f/2.8 center point, and advanced display options available on the Intelligent Viewfinder supply exceptional control. In-camera imaging features like HDR, HDR Backlight Control, Multiple Exposure, Handheld Night Scene, and Creative Filters available in real time help turn even simple images into spectacular photos. Elevating the possibilities of creative expression to extraordinary new heights, the powerful EOS 70D with Dual Pixel CMOS AF places the ability to capture both amazing stills and video right in your hands.

◊ As of July 2, 2013.
* This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

THE NEXT GENERATION IN LIVE VIEW AF.
DUAL PIXEL CMOS AF
The EOS 70D features Canon’s all-new Dual Pixel CMOS AF, a revolutionary leap forward in speed and accuracy that unlocks the potential of Live View shooting. This game-changing technology will forever change what is possible with a DSLR camera.

SHOOT VIDEO LIKE A CAMCORDER
The benefits of the groundbreaking Dual Pixel CMOS AF are clearly evident in video shooting, where bringing scenes and subjects into focus is a critical element of the final composition. On the EOS 70D, Dual Pixel CMOS AF helps ensure focus is achieved naturally and precisely, even when switching between subjects. And, combined with the predictive power of Movie Servo AF, subjects in motion are smoothly and consistently tracked – once the EOS 70D locks focus, it doesn’t let go. Plus, with the shallow depth-of-field afforded by EOS optics, your video gains a cinematic ambience.

COMPOSITIONAL FREEDOM, QUICK AND ACCURATE LIVE VIEW FOCUS
For stills, Dual Pixel CMOS AF makes Live View AF precise and faster than ever, freeing the photographer to take advantage of the freedom of angle afforded by the camera’s Vari-angle LCD monitor. Whether capturing images of athletes on the field or kids in the park – with a tripod or handheld and operated from a number of angles and positions – crisp focus can be obtained nearly instantly across a wide shooting area, especially useful for those spontaneous or fleeting shots. And, when composing and shooting in Live View mode, the image, exposure and chosen effects can be previewed before shooting, ensuring better accuracy, increased comfort, and more control from the start.

COMPATIBLE WITH 103◊ CANON EF LENSES
103◊ Canon EF lenses are able to fully realize the benefits of Dual Pixel CMOS AF. Compatible lenses greatly expand creative and compositional possibilities so users can enjoy a wide range of endeavors made possible through various lenses whether shooting still images or video. 

◊ As of July 2, 2013.

Click here for a larger image THE GENIUS OF PIXEL BASED AF
Dual Pixel CMOS AF is a cutting-edge Canon technology, made possible by a sophisticated redesigning of the CMOS sensor. Traditionally, image sensors have one photodiode per pixel, but the CMOS sensor on the EOS 70D has two photodiodes per pixel, enabling each pixel on the sensor to both perform phase-difference detection autofocus and capture light – a first for EOS cameras. With phase-difference detection AF, autofocus is achieved quickly and easily on the camera. This unique AF system enables autofocus on 80% of the image plane, vertically and horizontally, and helps ensure virtually no loss in image quality.

SOPHISTICATED WIRELESS SYSTEM.
Click here for a larger image THE SIMPLICITY AND CONVENIENCE OF WIRELESS TECHNOLOGY, BUILT-IN
The new EOS 70D incorporates cutting edge wireless technology right into its compact design. The camera’s exposure settings, such as aperture, shutter speed and ISO, focus, and shutter can be operated wirelessly using an iOS or Android smartphone* with the free Canon EOS Remote app**. Using a smartphone with the EOS Remote app** installed, you can shoot remotely from a distance, even in Live View mode, for those difficult-to-capture shots; you can also review images on the EOS 70D without having to take it out of the bag, and easily transfer and save images directly from the camera to a smartphone. Full DLNA (Digital Living Network Alliance) compatibility means easy sharing between the EOS 70D and other DLNA products, like HDTVs, smartphones and more. Still images can even be transferred between two wireless-enabled Canon cameras over a Local Area Network (LAN). Images and video can be uploaded instantly to CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# for easy sharing on social networking sites, and photos can even be printed on a wireless PictBridge certified printer without the need for a PC. Remarkably, the EOS 70D has all of these wireless features without the need for any additional accessories; they’re built right in!

* Compatible with iOS version 5.0 or later and Android devices version 2.3/4.0 or later. Data charges may apply. 
** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
# One-time registration required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

AMAZING CAPTURE AND PROCESSING POWER.
20.2 MEGAPIXEL CMOS (APS-C) SENSOR
Offering the highest pixel count of any APS-C sized sensor in EOS history, the EOS 70D camera’s 20.2 Megapixel CMOS sensor records a massive 5472 x 3648 pixels, perfect for even the biggest enlargements and offering enough resolution for significant cropping while maintaining the detail and essence of the particular scene. 14-bit signal processing ensures excellent tonal gradation and a wide ISO range of 100–12800 (H: 25600) ensures excellent image capture even in dim lighting situations. The EOS 70D camera’s image sensor combines with Canon’s powerful DIGIC 5+ Image Processor for improved data processing speeds, greater noise reduction, and even real-time compensation for chromatic aberration.

14-BIT A/D CONVERSION
With 14-bit analog-to-digital conversion, the EOS 70D captures and records images with remarkable gradations and detail in subtle tones and colors, resulting in more realistic and detailed images. By recording up to 16,384 colors per channel, the EOS 70D ensures that the fine detail found in subjects like foliage, sky and water are preserved and recorded with a tremendous level of accuracy, ensuring gorgeous results.

ISO 100–12800 AND EXPANDABLE TO 25600 IN H MODE
Thanks to its DIGIC 5+ Image Processor, the EOS 70D features an expanded ISO range of ISO 100–12800 (expandable to 25600 in H mode) that makes shooting possible in situations previously unthinkable without flash. The EOS 70D, with the DIGIC 5+ Image Processor’s remarkable noise-reduction technology, performs brilliantly in low-light shooting. Used with one of Canon’s EF or EF-S lenses with Optical Image Stabilizer, the EOS 70D can record beautiful images even when light sources are scarce.

DIGIC 5+ IMAGE PROCESSOR
For a whole new level of performance, the EOS 70D uses a DIGIC 5+ Image Processor. Working with two 4-channel A/D converter front-end processing circuits, and delivering speeds of up to 7.0 fps continuous shooting, the DIGIC 5+ Image Processor improves data processing performance and features algorithms that promote greater noise reduction at higher ISOs. In addition to conventional image processing functions, the DIGIC 5+ Image Processor offers real-time compensation for chromatic aberration in both still and motion images. With the power of this processor, speed improvements are noticeable from the instant the camera is turned on. The stunning results speak for themselves.

THE SPEED YOU NEED.
HIGH SPEED CONTINUOUS SHOOTING UP TO 7.0 FPS
Capable of shooting up to 7.0 fps during continuous shooting, the EOS 70D is a perfect camera for quick action. Canon’s remarkable shutter, combined with speedy, sophisticated electronics, ensures instant response and performance. A rapidly occurring scene can be captured moment by moment, second by second, so that even the briefest of opportunities are captured in perfect clarity.

TRUE HD PERFORMANCE IN YOUR HANDS.
EOS FULL HD MOVIE MODE WITH MOVIE SERVO AF AND 3–10X DIGITAL ZOOM AT FULL HD RESOLUTION
The EOS 70D captures HD video with an impressive level of sophistication, offering phenomenal performance on a DSLR camera. It offers both All-I (UHS-I memory card is required) and IPB compression, supports H.264/MPEG-4 AVC High Profile, and automatically splits files greater than 4GB (FAT specifications) for extended recording without interruption. It offers the option of time coding during recording only (Rec Run) or at all times (Free Run), which is useful for multi-camera shoots. It also features improved sound recording adjustment capabilities; the EOS 70D has an internal stereo microphone for enhanced audio capture and a wind filter feature to reduce wind noise when shooting outdoors. Sound recording levels can be manually (up to 64 different levels) or automatically controlled, while a built-in attenuator is also provided to reduce audio clipping. For more advanced audio recording, the EOS 70D is compatible with many third-party electret condenser microphones with a 3.5mm diameter plug. The EOS 70D also boasts the advanced Movie Digital Zoom, allowing you to magnify the center of the image by approximately 3x–10x when Full HD (1920 x 1080) resolution is set.

The EOS 70D features Movie Servo AF for continuous autofocus tracking of moving subjects while recording video. Combined with the camera’s Dual Pixel CMOS AF system, even fast subjects remain crisply in focus. Autofocus is smooth and continuous, and quiet when recording video using one of Canon’s STM lenses. The revolutionary performance of Canon’s Dual Pixel CMOS AF System, the predictive power of Movie Servo AF, and the pleasing depth-of-field provided by the EOS 70D’s optics make it possible to accomplish stunning, cinematic video capture, easily.

Movie Recording Size Total Recording Time 
(Approx. min.) File Size
(Approx. MB/min.) 8GB Card 16GB Card 1920 x 1080 30 fps IPB 32 64 235 All-I 11 22 685 25 fps IPB 32 64 235 All-I 11 22 685 24 fps IPB 32 64 235 All-I 11 22 685 1280 x 720 60 fps IPB 37 74 205 All-I 12 25 610 50 fps IPB 37 74 205 All-I 12 25 610 640 x 480 30 fps IPB 97 194 78 25 fps All-I 97 194 78 
VIDEO SNAPSHOT
With the Video Snapshot feature, the EOS 70D can capture short video clips (of 2, 4 or 8 seconds) then combine them automatically into one video file as a snapshot or highlights "album." With no editing needed after shooting, the compiled video is perfect for sharing online or displaying directly on an HDTV via the camera’s HDMI port. Additionally, stills can be recorded during video shooting simply by pressing the camera’s shutter button. During playback, video clips in an album can be reordered or deleted.

SHARP AND CLEAR, WITH TACTILE CONTROLS.
VARI-ANGLE TOUCH SCREEN 3.0-INCH CLEAR VIEW LCD MONITOR II WITH MULTI-TOUCH OPERATION AND TOUCH AF
The EOS 70D comes with a Vari-angle Touch Screen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II for shooting videos and stills at a variety of angles, high or low, with up to 180° of rotation. Using capacitive technology similar to today’s popular mobile devices, this screen is touch-sensitive and delivers intuitive touch panel operation. Two-finger touch gestures can be used for zooming or changing images. Menu and quick control settings can be accessed, and focus point and shutter release can be activated with the touch of a fingertip using Touch AF. Displaying fine detail (at approximately 1.04 million dots), this screen is perfect for composing and reviewing images. Thanks to a solid construction between the monitor’s resin-coated cover and the liquid crystal display, reflections are minimized, and the display can be viewed, without glare, from any number of angles. The LCD’s surface is treated with a smudge-resistant coating to minimize fingerprints and maintain a bright, clear image display.

FAST, ACCURATE, PHENOMENAL AF.
19-POINT ALL CROSS-TYPE AF SYSTEM (INCLUDING A HIGH-PRECISION F/2.8 DUAL CROSS-TYPE AF CENTER POINT)
The EOS 70D has a high-performance AF system that’s ready for anything. The camera features 19 high precision cross-type AF sensors, all of which can be selected automatically or manually. With cross-type AF points placed throughout a wide area, the EOS 70D’s AF system ensures amazing compositional flexibility whether shooting vertically or horizontally, and is superbly equipped to track the subject, even if movements are erratic or unpredictable. And with its high-precision f/2.8 dual cross-type AF center point, the EOS 70D delivers a whole new level of focus accuracy when shooting with lenses of f/2.8 or faster. The EOS 70D camera’s AF modes can be customized to suit the situation, helping ensure reliable focus.

SOPHISTICATED COMPOSITION, SIMPLY.
INTELLIGENT VIEWFINDER WITH SUPERIMPOSED LCD DISPLAY PROVIDES APPROXIMATELY 98% FIELD OF VIEW
The EOS 70D camera’s Intelligent Viewfinder offers a sharp, bright, approximately 98% field of view with an approximate magnification of 0.95x, a viewing angle of 27.9° and a 22mm eyepoint. Featuring a new coating that reduces reflections and new construction that improves response in cold environments, the EOS 70D’s Intelligent Viewfinder makes it simple to adjust and confirm settings without the risk of missing a beat. The Intelligent Viewfinder uses a transparent LCD to superimpose a customizable combination of focus points and gridlines directly over the image: it displays AF mode, AF points, electronic level, grid, alerts informing when white balance is being corrected and when Spot metering is enabled, and much more. With the EOS 70D’s Intelligent Viewfinder, unlike with other cameras, the photographer has the choice of seeing shooting information or looking only at the scene in front of the camera. The ability to effectively erase all shooting data and turn it back on with the touch of a button gives the photographer the opportunity to concentrate simply on looking and composing the photograph without distraction, a great advantage in numerous shooting situations.

AMAZING EFFECTS FOR DRAMATIC AND GORGEOUS RESULTS.
HIGH DYNAMIC RANGE (HDR)
With its High Dynamic Range (HDR) mode, the EOS 70D can merge three images of varying exposure in-camera and save them as one final image, capturing a broad range of shadow and highlight detail with stunning tonal range. Adjustable to cover a range of Â±3 stops, HDR recording truly expands the parameters of the light and dark detail a camera can actually record, surprising viewers with the range of tones a photograph can accurately recreate.

MULTIPLE EXPOSURE CONTROL
The EOS 70D offers a Multiple Exposure mode for film-like image creation with the convenience of in-camera processing. It offers two different compositing methods for proper exposure and composition: additive or average. Multiple exposure shots from 2 to 9 are stored as one final image and can be taken in both RAW and JPEG shooting modes. A RAW image previously captured by the EOS 70D (3:2 aspect ratio only) can be used as a starting point, and cumulative results can be observed and corrected in real time on the camera's LCD screen.

HANDHELD NIGHT SCENE MODE
Handheld Night Scene mode captures nightscapes with bright highlights and detailed dark areas, delivering results previously difficult without the use of a tripod. By shooting and combining four consecutive shots at a shutter speed fast enough to avoid camera shake, the EOS 70D’s Handheld Night Scene mode makes dramatic nighttime photography simple.

HDR BACKLIGHT CONTROL MODE
The EOS 70D camera’s HDR Backlight Control mode ensures that backlit subjects are not recorded too darkly. By automatically shooting three consecutive shots at different exposures (underexposed, correctly exposed and overexposed) and combining the images, the final result maintains detail in both the shadow and highlight areas, ensuring the backlit subject is properly exposed.

SEVEN CREATIVE FILTERS THAT CAN BE DISPLAYED IN REAL TIME
To add to the fun and creative possibilities available with the EOS 70D, the camera has seven different Creative Filters that can dramatically alter the mood and visual effect of any particular scene. Creative Filters include Grainy Black and White, Soft Focus, Fisheye Effect, Toy Camera Effect, Miniature Effect, Art Bold Effect and Water Painting Effect. Each effect can be applied in three different levels (low, standard and strong), and easily previewed on the LCD panel in Live View. Since the filters can be applied to the image after shooting, it's easy to try several effects on the same shot during post-process.

COMPLEX FUNCTIONS MADE SIMPLE.
SCENE INTELLIGENT AUTO MODE
The EOS 70D features Scene Intelligent Auto mode, which incorporates a number of Canon technologies to deliver the best possible exposure. Joining Picture Style Auto, Automatic Lighting Optimizer, Automatic White Balance, Autofocus, and Automatic Exposure, Scene Intelligent Auto mode analyzes the image, accounting for faces, colors, brightness, moving objects, contrast, even whether the camera is handheld or on a tripod, and then chooses the exposure and enhancements that bring out the best in any scene or situation.

MORE FEATURES FOR INCREASED VERSATILITY.
COMPATIBLE WITH THE FULL LINE OF CANON EF AND EF-S LENSES
The EOS 70D is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF lineup, including compact and lightweight EF-S lenses, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses and including the STM series optimized for video shooting. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver outstanding performance and deliver beautiful results. Special technologies like Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer help to minimize the effect of camera shake, effectively adding up to four stops of light; STM lenses even feature a stepping motor for smooth and quiet continuous autofocus while capturing video. With an array of lenses perfect for travel, sports, still life and everything in between, photographers can truly maximize the quality and performance of their EOS 70D camera.

MULTI SHOT NOISE REDUCTION
To enhance its already admirable high ISO shooting capabilities, the EOS 70D camera features an intelligent Multi Shot Noise Reduction tool that reduces noise even further than the camera’s sensor and the DIGIC 5+ Image Processor do. With Multi Shot Noise Reduction activated, the camera takes four consecutive shots, merges and aligns them. This eliminates more noise than the camera’s traditional Noise Reduction filter, with little or no apparent resolution loss. Moving subjects are even optimized to minimize subject blur! Thanks to this clever feature, high ISO shooting has never looked better.

LENS ABERRATION CORRECTION
The EOS 70D features lens correction tools that compensate for lens characteristics that can affect overall image quality. The EOS 70D camera’s Peripheral Illumination Correction feature corrects light falloff in the corner of the image according to the characteristics of the lens being used. It even has correction data for a number of popular lenses stored in its memory. With the chromatic aberration correction tool, distracting color fringing can be corrected at the time of shooting.

FEATURE GUIDE
To help explain the specific function of features found on the EOS 70D, the Feature Guide displays a simple description helpful in determining the applicability for the situation at hand. It is displayed in each shooting mode, during mode dial operations, and for Quick Control screen functions. It appears automatically when a function is selected – a lifesaver when trying to determine the best mode or function for the next picture. The feature guide works automatically by default, and can be disabled easily through the camera’s menu.

GPS COMPATIBLE
With the optional GPS Receiver GP-E2 attached to the hot shoe or the digital terminal, the EOS 70D can record location, including latitude, longitude and altitude, and has the ability to track the trajectory of movement with its logging function, perfect for photographers on the go. An electric compass records the camera’s orientation during each shot, and world time information is recorded through GPS syncing.

IMAGE RATING
To help organize images recorded to the camera’s storage, the EOS 70D makes it simple to rate individual images from one star to five. Therefore, image browsing, printing and slide shows can be based upon those ratings.

COMPATIBILITY WITH SD/SDHC/SDXC MEMORY CARDS, INCLUDING ULTRA HIGH SPEED (UHS-I) CARDS
The EOS 70D uses popular SD, SDHC, SDXC, and is even compatible with Ultra High Speed (UHS-I), memory cards. Compact and available in large capacities, SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards are a perfect complement to the camera’s compact design.
